body: Sounds good! Can you do a PR?

Careful with the current JDK `WatchService` as it will miss changes if the file is _bind mounted_. In container based productions this is likely `/etc/hosts` is bind mounted.

I wrote a bit a few years ago : https://blog.arkey.fr/2019/09/13/watchservice-and-bind-mount/
@bric3 I think we should just re-read after X seconds.

Agreed, polling is the cheapest thing to do and it's portable.
That's what I ended up doing.
It would be good if we keep this non-blocking ...

I think what we should do is very similar to here : https://github.com/netty/netty/blob/4.1/resolver-dns-classes-macos/src/main/java/io/netty/resolver/dns/macos/MacOSDnsServerAddressStreamProvider.java#L170

issue.title: Re-read /etc/hosts upon change

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Re-read /etc/hosts periodically in `DefaultHostsFileEntriesResolver`

Motivation:

`io.netty.resolver.DefaultHostsFileEntriesResolver` parses `/etc/hosts` only once, upon creation.
With these changes `DefaultHostsFileEntriesResolver` will periodically re-read configuration.

Modification:
1. Made `HostsFileEntriesProvider.Parser` dependency injectable via constructor to be able to test my changes
2. Added entries `expiry` check and re-read before resolving addresses
3. `address` now uses `addresses` function inside

Result:
`DefaultHostsFileEntriesResolver` now re-reads data from hosts file every 10 seconds. 

Fixes #<GitHub issue number>. 
#11661

issue.title: The dns resolver does not re-read /etc/hosts upon change

repository.name: vert.x
repository.description: Vert.x is a tool-kit for building reactive applications on the JVM

issue.body:
#### Describe the feature

As described in the old issue #2254 the hosts file is only read on start, [this is still true](https://github.com/eclipse-vertx/vert.x/blob/5d7cc0cc7266ce2db9969821cf8fa3ed78acc0db/src/main/java/io/vertx/core/impl/resolver/DnsResolverProvider.java#L92) and should be fixed in my opinion.

#### Use cases

There are several valid use cases that rely on the hosts file being properly interpreted, if a vertx process needs a restart on every change that is a big drawback. This problem is already solved in netty, see https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/11661.
